title: Phoebe Waller-Bridge writes a joke for Taylor Swift that's a bit too British in SNL promo
text:
With just two days until Phoebe Waller-Bridge hosts Saturday Night Live for the first time, a new promo teases some witty banter between the host and musical guest Taylor Swift.

The 34 year old Fleabag star and creator seemingly used her Emmy-winning writing skills on the show, writing a joke for the 29 year old pop sensation.

The problem was, it seems, the joke by the London native was a bit too British for the Pennsylvania-raised singer.

Witty banter: With just two days until Phoebe Waller-Bridge hosts Saturday Night Live for the first time, a new promo teases some witty banter between the host and musical guest Taylor Swift

Jokes: The 34 year old Fleabag star and creator seemingly used her Emmy-winning writing skills on the show, writing a joke for the 29 year old pop sensation

The promo begins with Waller-Bridge stating, 'I'm hosting Saturday Night Live this week with musical guest Taylor Swift.'

Swift then says her line, but it gets awkward quite quickly, when it becomes clear that Waller-Bridge wrote the joke.

'It's gonna be mental, innit? Like a randy... did you write this?' Swift asks Waller-Bridge.

Promo: The promo begins with Waller-Bridge stating, 'I'm hosting Saturday Night Live this week with musical guest Taylor Swift'

'Yeah, sorry. It's too British, isn't it?' Waller-Bridge asks, with Swift responding, 'Just a little bit.

While Swift will be the musical guest, it wouldn't be surprising if she was used in a sketch or two as well.

She has previously starred in movies such as Valentine's Day and The Giver, adn she will next be seen on the big screen in Cats, opening Christmas Day.

Little bit: 'Yeah, sorry. It's too British, isn't it?' Waller-Bridge asks, with Swift responding, 'Just a little bit

Swift sketch: While Swift will be the musical guest, it wouldn't be surprising if she was used in a sketch or two as well

Waller-Bridge is coming off her three Emmy wins for Fleabag, winning Outstanding Writing for a Comedy Series, Outstanding Lead Actress in a Comedy Series and Outstanding Comedy Series.

She was also nominated for Outstanding Drama Series for the other hit show she created, Killing Eve, starring newly minted Emmy winner Jodie Comer and Sandra Oh.

She also co-wrote the script for the new James Bond movie No Time To Die, starring Daniel Craig.

Emmy win: Waller-Bridge is coming off her three Emmy wins for Fleabag, winning Outstanding Writing for a Comedy Series, Outstanding Lead Actress in a Comedy Series and Outstanding Comedy Series

Swift released her seventh studio album Lover in August, and shortly thereafter, she announced a US and European tour dubbed Lover Fest.

The tour kicks off June 20, 2020 in Werchter, Belgium, with stops in Germany, Norway, Denmark, France and Portugal.

Her brief North American tour kicks off at SoFi Stadium in Inglewood, California, the future home of the Los Angles Rams, on July 25 and 26, 2020.

She will be the first person ever to perform in the stadium, and also becomes the first woman ever to open an NFL stadium.
description: With just two days until Phoebe Waller-Bridge hosts Saturday Night Live for the first time, a new promo teases some witty banter between the host and musical guest Taylor Swift.
